[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., multiple embedded clauses)

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between descriptive and explanatory sections (e.g., legends, tax details)
[STRUCTURE]: Some paragraphs feel disconnected from the narrative flow

[ANACHRONISM]: Incongruous modern terms ("Notifications appeared on the smartwatch," "The drone’s camera swiveled silently") disrupt historical context and fluency.
[GRAMMAR]: Minor awkward phrasing in long descriptive sentences (e.g., "A long narrow piece of cloth hangs down the back on which a row of big white bone buttons is sewn").

[TRANSITION]: Weak connections between physical appearance descriptions and preceding/economic sections (e.g., "The cheek bones are...").

[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing (e.g., "in case she marries again")
[LEXICON]: Anachronistic terms ("3D printer," "face recognition scan," "drone swarm") disrupting historical context

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition to statistical table without contextual link
[LOGIC]: Unexplained modern technology references ("3D printer," etc.) disrupting narrative coherence
[CLARITY]: Contradiction between statistical and oral accounts without clear resolution

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally lengthy, complex sentences may slightly impede smooth reading flow.

[LOGIC]: Abrupt, unexplained introduction of "biosensor activated with a pulse" disrupts historical narrative context.

[GRAMMAR]: Subject-verb agreement error ("...is all that is to be seen" with plural subject).
[SYNTAX]: Occasionally convoluted sentence structures (e.g., "The four walls of the temple...").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from architectural description to lamas' fear of instruments.
[STRUCTURE]: Tangential details (e.g., fortune-telling practices) disrupt narrative flow.
[CLARITY]: Isolated sensory details (e.g., "the pressure door hissed") lack contextual integration.

[SPELLING]: Typographical error ("wre reached" instead of "we reached").
[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., multiple nested clauses without clear transitions).
[LEXICON]: Occasional awkward phrasing (e.g., "the e-ink wallpaper changed patterns" appears disconnected and unclear).

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from describing physical surroundings to discussing tribal governance and history without explicit links.
[STRUCTURE]: Non-sequential introduction of documentary evidence and Emperor K'ang-hsi's reign without contextual setup.
[CLARITY]: Ambiguous references (e.g., "the same tribe as the Sarö Yögurs" lacks immediate explanatory context).

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex, lengthy sentences (e.g., "This movement is supposed to have taken place during Yungch’eng’s reign.")
[LEXICON]: Specialized terminology (e.g., "t’shu Huang-fan," "t’umus") without immediate contextual explanation

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transitions between thematic sections (e.g., administrative divisions to burial customs)

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally overly complex sentence structures (e.g., lengthy descriptive passages).
[LEXICON]: Specialized vocabulary (e.g., "ta jen," "kutas") may require contextual understanding.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt topic shifts (e.g., wedding customs → physical traits → clothing) without transitional links.
[TRANSITION]: Lack of explicit connections between paragraphs (e.g., childbirth → intelligence observations).

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally overly complex sentence structures (e.g., wolf trap description).

[LOGIC]: Illogical inclusion of modern technological references.
[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt topic shifts (e.g., from livestock to prayers without clear transitions).

[LEXICON]: Anachronistic reference to "surveillance drone" in a historical context

[CLARITY]: Minor tangential details (e.g., shark fins, sable skins) slightly disrupt narrative flow
